meanings.definition: To scratch or tear with the claws.
meanings.sent1: The cat was clawing at the furniture.
meanings.sent2: She saw the bear clawing at the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was clawing at the yarn ball.
meanings.sent4: The climber was clawing his way up the steep rock face.
meanings.sent5: The zombie's hands were clawing at the door, trying to get in.

meanings.definition: To grasp or seize with the claws.
meanings.sent1: The eagle was clawing its prey with precision.
meanings.sent2: The lobster was clawing at the fish to catch it.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended to be a monster, clawing at imaginary foes.
meanings.sent4: The vines were clawing their way up the old building.
meanings.sent5: The robot's mechanical hand was clawing at the metal bar.
